Detailed Description

This module formats simple JSON, in a linear fashion, using a character buffer that the client provides.

Attention
Copyright (c) Electronic Arts 2012.
Note
    When JsonInit() is called, a 24-bytes header is added at the beginning of the
    client-provided buffer. The header is an ascii string that looks like this:
        <AAAAAAAABBBBBBBBCCDD />
            where:
                AAAAAAAA is the offset field
                BBBBBBBB is the buffer size field
                CC is the indent field
                DD is the flag field
    Those first 24 bytes are replaced by whitespaces when JsonFinish() is called.

    Required buffer capacity for json = ??? length(JSON) + 1.
    That means if length(buffer) <= length(JSON), buffer-overrun occurs.
Version
12/11/2012 (jbrookes) First Version, based on XmlFormat

Function Documentation

char* JsonFormatVPrintf ( char *  pJsonBuff,
int32_t  iBufLen,
const char *  pFormat,
va_list  pFmtArgs 
)

Takes a format string and variable parameter list and formats into syntax correct JSON. The "v" (variable args) version can be called by other functions that use "..." in the their prototype.

Parameters
*pJsonBuff- JSON output buffer
iBufLen- length of Json output buffer (negative=append to existing buffer)
*pFormat- printf style format string
pFmtArgs- variable argument list (use va_start / va_end to get)
Returns
char * - pointer to formatted buffer
Version
12/11/2012 (jbrookes)

References ds_timeinsecs(), JSON_FL_WHITESPACE, JsonFinish(), and JsonInit().

Referenced by JsonFormatPrintf().

void JsonInit ( char *  pBuffer,
int32_t  iBufLen,
unsigned char  uFlags 
)

Initialize the Json Buffer. This MUST be called prior to any other calls. Client can allocate the buffer on stack, but should not access it directly. (see JsonData()).

Parameters
*pBuffer- buffer to which JSON will be written.
iBufLen– size of buffer passed in.
uFlags- encoding flags (JSONFORMAT_FL_xxx)
Version
12/11/2012 (jbrookes)

References ds_snzprintf(), and JSON_HEADER_LEN.

Referenced by JsonFormatVPrintf().
